body:
This looks pretty good.  Please let me know if you have any questions.

---

Reviewed 13 of 19 files at r1, 3 of 4 files at r2, 4 of 5 files at r3, 2 of 2 files at r4, 1 of 1 files at r5.
Review status: all files reviewed, 15 unresolved discussions (waiting on @AspirinSJL)

---

*[include/grpc/server_load_reporting.h, line 34 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwYs9DEyKIAYU_vJkz:-LFwYs9DEyKIAYU_vJl-:b-hsixrj) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/include/grpc/server_load_reporting.h#L34)):*
> ```objc
> // verify the request and to allow the server to report load to the gRPC LB
> // system. The token is also used in client stats for reporting dropped calls.
> #define GRPC_LB_TOKEN_MD_KEY "lb-token"
> ```

Perhaps these should just move to `include/grpcpp/ext/server_load_reporting.h`?  There doesn't seem to be a need for these in C-core.

---

*[include/grpcpp/ext/server_load_reporting.h, line 42 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwj8ZrCH07PIhezVcN:-LFwj8ZrCH07PIhezVcO:b8sei6x) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/include/grpcpp/ext/server_load_reporting.h#L42)):*
> ```objc
> // TODO(juanlishen): Put this option into ServerBuilder when OpenCensus can be
> // built with other building tools.
> void EnableServerLoadReporting();
> ```

We'll need a gRFC for this addition to our API.

---

*[include/grpcpp/impl/codegen/server_context.h, line 205 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwb3LK4yGb-Ra4-hwm:-LFwb3LK4yGb-Ra4-hwn:b-tknazl) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/3acf8e62079e727ae1925be759fa917f10e982bb/include/grpcpp/impl/codegen/server_context.h#L205)):*
> ```objc
> 
>   /// Set the load reporting costs in \a cost_data for the call.
>   void SetLoadReportingCosts(const std::vector<grpc::string>& cost_data);
> ```

This is part of our public API.  I don't think it's okay to remove this.

---

*[src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.h, line 90 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwZovNEBfKV90K3mGz:-LFwZovNEBfKV90K3mH-:b9kajbj) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/src/core/ext/filters/load_reporting/server_load_reporting_filter.h#L90)):*
> ```objc
>   // recv_initial_metadata_ready_ closure, before the original
>   // recv_initial_metadata_ready closure.
>   // TODO(juanlishen): We should be able to use MetadataBatch here, but its
> ```

The `MetadataBatch` object is a temporary object owned by `TransportStreamOpBatch`, which is itself only a temporary object -- neither of them continue to exist beyond the call to the filter's `StartTransportStreamOpBatch()` method.  So it's not expected to be able to store the `MetadataBatch` object beyond that.

If you really want to use `MetadataBatch` here, you could do something like this:

```
grpc_core::ManualConstructor<MetadataBatch> recv_initial_metadata_;
```

Then in `StartTransportStreamOpBatch()`, you can do this:

```
recv_initial_metadata_.Init(op->recv_initial_metadata()->batch();
```

That having been said, I'm not sure it's really worth the effort to use `MetadataBatch`.  Frankly, that class is a fairly weak abstraction and doesn't really provide much benefit.  I think this will eventually get better when we natively convert the filter API to C++.

For now, I think it's fine to use `grpc_metadata_batch` directly.

---

*[src/cpp/server/load_reporter/constants.h, line 31 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwbLbPDCHfeVZx_GNm:-LFwbLbPDCHfeVZx_GNn:bxjhra2) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/src/cpp/server/load_reporter/constants.h#L31)):*
> ```objc
> constexpr uint32_t kVersion = 15853;
> 
> constexpr uint32_t kFeedbackSampleWindowSeconds = 10;
> ```

Should these parameters be configurable?

---

*[src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter.h, line 65 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwbd208iXoxA3uBLkm:-LFwbd208iXoxA3uBLkn:b-rrph9f) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter.h#L65)):*
> ```objc
>       const ViewDataMap& view_data_map, const char* view_name,
>       size_t view_name_len, const std::vector<grpc::string>& tag_values,
>       bool is_double);
> ```

What does this parameter do?  Please document.

This is particularly confusing, since the return type is `double` even if this parameter is false.

---

*[src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter.cc, line 173 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwbsJ35hwH4eNK6pxU:-LFwbsJ35hwH4eNK6pxV:b-oi74db) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter.cc#L173)):*
> ```cpp
>     auto it_row = it_vd->second.int_data().find(tag_values);
>     GPR_ASSERT(it_row != it_vd->second.int_data().end());
>     return it_row->second;
> ```

This will implicitly cast the integer to a double, which may lose precision.

I think a better API would be to provide two output parameters, one a `double*` and the other an `int64*`.  The caller needs to set one of them to null and the other to non-null, and the function will fill in whichever one is non-null.

---

*[src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter.cc, line 262 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwcrldBRjbSAv_wEB2:-LFwcrldBRjbSAv_wEB3:bebyyks) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter.cc#L262)):*
> ```cpp
>   uint64_t rpcs = 0;
>   uint64_t errors = 0;
>   for (auto p = newest; p != oldest; --p) {
> ```

Please go back to using `LoadBalancingFeedbackRecord*` here.

---

*[src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter_async_service_impl.h, line 92 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwdcO2DV0A4Yk3HK2M:-LFwdcO2DV0A4Yk3HK2N:bdpqgcr) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter_async_service_impl.h#L92)):*
> ```objc
>    private:
>     // The members related to refcounting.
>     void Ref(const grpc_core::DebugLocation& location, const char* reason);
> ```

Consider having this class derive from `grpc_core::InternallyRefCounted<>`, so that we don't have to roll these methods ourselves.

Alternatively, since this is C++ code, consider just using `std::shared_ptr<>`.

---

*[src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter_async_service_impl.cc, line 39 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwebQwBR80BYcdgYzQ:-LFwebQwBR80BYcdgYzR:bsou4rf) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter_async_service_impl.cc#L39)):*
> ```cpp
>   cpu_stats_provider.reset(new CpuStatsProviderDefaultImpl());
> #endif
>   load_reporter_ = std::unique_ptr<LoadReporter>(new LoadReporter(
> ```

Consider using `std::make_unique<>` here.

---

*[src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter_async_service_impl.cc, line 57 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwghBB0fJfmPLzWXi0:-LFwghBB0fJfmPLzWXi1:b-dezu1p) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter_async_service_impl.cc#L57)):*
> ```cpp
> 
> void LoadReporterAsyncServiceImpl::ScheduleNextFetchAndSample() {
>   auto next_step = new std::function<void(bool)>(
> ```

It would be more efficient to make these `std::function<>` objects be class members.  That way, we would not have to allocate memory whenever we want to use one.

Same thing throughout.

---

*[src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter_async_service_impl.cc, line 129 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwhVdL2r1QxeSrOiuL:-LFwhVdL2r1QxeSrOiuM:b5vray) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporter_async_service_impl.cc#L129)):*
> ```cpp
>       return;
>     }
>     // Re-use the initial ref for on_done.
> ```

If possible, it would be nice to hold the ref in some kind of smart pointer (e.g., `std::shared_ptr<>` or `grpc_core::RefCountedPtr<>`) and pass it along with the `on_done` callback as a pre-bound parameter.  That way, the compiler can enforce the refcounting semantics.

Same thing throughout.

---

*[src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporting_service_server_builder_plugin.cc, line 45 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwiOlT14W-AM88VROT:-LFwiOlT14W-AM88VROU:b-jk4wop) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporting_service_server_builder_plugin.cc#L45)):*
> ```cpp
>     grpc::ServerBuilder* builder) {
>   auto cq = builder->AddCompletionQueue();
>   service_ = std::shared_ptr<LoadReporterAsyncServiceImpl>(
> ```

Consider using `std::make_shared<>` here.

---

*[src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporting_service_server_builder_plugin.cc, line 62 at r5](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15853#-LFwiSRVElbuSUcNDNFR:-LFwiSRVElbuSUcNDNFS:bsou4rf) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/513d5fba60654389dece186393188dcdcd303b02/src/cpp/server/load_reporter/load_reporting_service_server_builder_plugin.cc#L62)):*
> ```cpp
> std::unique_ptr<grpc::ServerBuilderPlugin>
> CreateLoadReportingServiceServerBuilderPlugin() {
>   return std::unique_ptr<LoadReportingServiceServerBuilderPlugin>(
> ```

Consider using `std::make_unique<>` here.

---
